metadata.title: Reconnaissance & Information Gathering
metadata.description: Tools and techniques for passive and active information gathering, network discovery, OSINT, and infrastructure intelligence

categories.title: Network Discovery & Mapping
categories.description: Tools for discovering and mapping network infrastructure through active and passive methods

subcategories.title: Active Scanning
subcategories.description: Direct scanning techniques for port discovery, host identification, and service enumeration

subcategories.title: Port Scanners
subcategories.description: Tools for discovering open ports and services

subcategories.title: TCP-Only Scanners
subcategories.description: Port scanners optimized for TCP-only scanning

items.name: Zmap
items.description: Single-packet network scanner optimized for Internet-wide TCP surveys. Can scan entire IPv4 space in 45 minutes
items.popularityNote: Preferred tool for Internet-wide research and mapping

items.name: RustScan
items.description: Lightning-fast TCP port scanner that can scan all 65k ports in 3 seconds, then pipes results to Nmap for detailed analysis
items.popularityNote: Popular for its speed - performs rapid discovery before handing off to Nmap

subcategories.title: UDP Scanners
subcategories.description: UDP-focused port scanning tools

items.name: udp-proto-scanner
items.description: UDP protocol scanner for discovering UDP services

items.name: unicornscan
items.description: Asynchronous TCP/UDP scanner with its own userland TCP/IP stack. Supports advanced protocol-specific probes
items.popularityNote: Less maintained but powerful for advanced users needing custom TCP/IP manipulation

subcategories.title: Multi-Protocol Scanners
subcategories.description: Comprehensive scanners supporting multiple protocols (TCP, UDP, SCTP, IP)

items.name: Nmap
items.description: The de facto standard for network discovery and security auditing. Supports TCP, UDP, SCTP, IP protocol scanning, OS detection, version detection, and scriptable interaction via NSE
items.popularityNote: The industry standard network scanner used by security professionals worldwide. Featured in every security course and certification

items.name: Masscan
items.description: The fastest Internet port scanner. Can scan the entire Internet in under 5 minutes using custom TCP/IP stack. Primarily TCP with banner grabbing
items.popularityNote: Fastest scanner available - transmits up to 10 million packets/second. Used for Internet-wide surveys and large network discovery

items.name: Angry IP Scanner
items.description: Fast and user-friendly network scanner with GUI. Supports TCP port scanning, ping scanning, and NetBIOS information gathering
items.popularityNote: Popular among network administrators for its simple GUI and no installation requirement

items.name: Advanced Port Scanner
items.description: Windows-focused network scanner with RDP/Radmin integration, Wake-On-LAN, and remote shutdown capabilities
items.popularityNote: Preferred by Windows administrators for its integration with Windows-specific protocols and remote management features

subcategories.description: Tools for discovering active hosts on networks

items.name: arp-scan
items.description: ARP scanner for discovering hosts on local networks

items.name: netdiscover
items.description: Active/passive network address discovering tool using ARP

subcategories.description: Host discovery using ICMP protocol

items.name: fping

items.name: hping3

subcategories.title: Multi-protocol Discovery

items.name: nmap discovery modes
items.description: Various host discovery techniques available in Nmap
